text:
NaNs occur frequently, e.g. after SPM preprocessing.
As a general rule, NaNs should not be ignored, but has a deleterious effect in low-level such functions. I propose to impute by 0's in the add_edges() function, but leaves Nans otherwise.
title: add_edges() fails when there is a NaN in the image
add_edges() fails when there is a NaN in the image
